objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to explore the utility of large language models (LLMs), particularly ChatGPT4, in combination with application program interfaces (APIs) for tasks such as experimental design, programming workflows, and data analysis in scanning probe microscopy.
objective.evidence: Here, we explore the utility of LLM, particularly ChatGPT4, in combination with application program interfaces (APIs) in tasks of experimental design, programming workflows, and data analysis in scanning probe microscopy.

knowledge_gap.answer: The paper addresses the gap in utilizing LLMs as a language interface for scientific instrumentation, specifically in automating and streamlining the process of experiment design and execution in microscopy, which traditionally requires significant expertise and manual operation.
knowledge_gap.evidence: Traditionally, mastering microscopy techniques for scientific discovery often requires years of training. Recently, the rapid progress in the artificial intelligence (AI) field propelled the development of AE in microscopes for physics discoveries.

answer: Integration of LLMs with APIs to assist in programming workflows for scanning probe microscopy.
Use of LLMs to convert human instructions into executable workflow scripts for scientific instruments.
Development of AE-GPT, a version of ChatGPT4 trained with AEcroscoPy guidelines for microscope automation.
evidence: We investigate the potential of combining LLMs with APIs to serve as a language interface assisting researchers in preparing workflows and operating scanning probe microscopy (SPM).
This language interface would allow for converting human instructions to executable workflow scripts, assisting in data analysis, and automating the reproduction of experiments.
We employ ChatGPT4 and AEcroscoPy to investigate the application of LLMs in API environment.

inspirational_papers.answer:

inspirational_papers.evidence: AE-microscopes utilize a range of machine learning (ML) methods, including supervised ML, active learning, and reinforcement learning for on-the-fly data analysis and decision-making, automating microscope operation, and facilitating physics discovery.

limitations.name: Limited Scientific Interpretation
limitations.description: AE-GPT's ability in scientific interpretation is very limited, offering mostly definitions rather than insights.
limitations.evidence: The interpretation is mostly just the definition of certain scientific concept, such interpretation offers limited insights and even can be wrong in some scenarios.

limitations.name: Lack of Advanced Experiment Design
limitations.description: AE-GPT lacks the ability to design advanced experiments based on literature.
limitations.evidence: AE-GPT is also lack of designing advanced experiments based on literatures, as indicated in Supplemental Note-II.

future_directions.name: Develop Domain-Specific LLMs
future_directions.description: Create LLMs specifically trained on scientific literature and instrument manuals for better performance.
future_directions.evidence: To overcome these drawbacks, domain specific LLMs, as well as fine-tuning by domain experts, will be required.
